intro: Epidendrum harrisoniae, commonly known as the Harrison's Epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central America. It is characterized by its pendulous, showy inflorescences that bear clusters of fragrant, violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), with a waxy surface that helps retain moisture. Epidendrum harrisoniae requires bright, indirect light and consistent humidity to thrive in cultivation.
